title: Palestinians' long march toward international justice
summary: Launched in the mid-2000s, attempts to put the Palestinian issue on the international judicial agenda came to fruition on November 21, with the issue of arrest warrants for the Israeli prime minister, his former defense minister and a Hamas official, for war crimes and crimes against humanity.

title: Far-right populist set to qualify for second round runoff in Romania presidential election
summary: According to the latest figures, Calin Georgescu, a populist who ran as an independent, will face left-wing Prime Minister Marcel Ciolacu on December 8.

title: COP29 reaches agreement with bitter taste for countries of the South
summary: On Sunday, nations attending the conference in Baku pledged $300 billion a year to help developing countries adapt to climate change by 2035. The amount is far less than they had been asking for.

title: Three suspects arrested in UAE after Israeli-Moldovan rabbi killed
summary: The 28-year-old man, who was found by security services, was a member of the Chabad Hasidic movement, an ultra-Orthodox Jewish group.

title: Puerto Rico's eternally  thwarted dream: the 51st US state
summary: For the fourth time in 12 years, Puerto Ricans voted overwhelmingly in favor of their island's admission to the US. But there is also an increasing rejection of the "colonial problem" in this territory, with its vague status as a "free associated state," and the pro-independence vote is on the rise.

title: Russian plane catches fire during landing, all aboard safe
summary: The Azimuth Airlines plane caught fire as it landed at an airport in southern Turkey. All 95 people on board were evacuated.

title: World meets in Busan to face challenge of out-of-control plastic pollution
summary: Delegates from 175 countries are expected from November 25 to December 1 in Busan, South Korea, to finalize a global treaty to end plastic pollution.

title: The most anti-Palestinian administration in US history
summary: Donald Trump has already nominated figures who stand out for their unprecedented hostility to the Palestinian people and their rights.

title: War in Ukraine: 'Anastasia, 14, was killed in a bombardment in Sumy. Three days later, a Russian missile caused panic when it flew over her funeral.'
summary: Photographer Adrien Vautier, in Ukraine for "Le Monde,"  witnessed the search for victims in an apartment building  20 kilometers from the border after it was hit by a Russian strike. He recounts the pain of the families and the horror of those who knew Anastasia, one of the children killed, when a Russian cruise missile passed just above the cemetery during her burial.

title: Pepe Mujica, former president of Uruguay: 'Contemporary democracy is sick'
summary: In an interview with Le Monde ahead of the second round of the country's presidential election on Sunday, November 24, the former head of state and his wife, former vice president Lucía Topolansky, condemn the consumer society and call for greater simplicity.

title: Carrefour faces boycott calls in Brazil over pledge not to sell South American meat in France
summary: Carrefour CEO Alexandre Bompard said the chain would not sell meat from Mercosur countries in France, as French farmers protested against a trade deal with the South American bloc.

title: First love: 'Life is cruel in giving us this gift only now'
summary: They met, fell in love and drifted apart. Then life brought them together again. Hélène, 77, shares her story with Gabriel, 83.

title: Deadly Israeli bombing in Beirut: 'No one in the building survived'
summary: The Israeli army bombed an eight-story building in the heart of the Lebanese capital, killing at least 29. Israeli officials said the target was Mohammad Haydar, head of Hezbollah operations, without confirming his death.

title: 'Uniting the fights against racism and anti-Semitism is essential to countering their manipulation'
summary: In a country like France, home to Europe's largest Jewish and Arab communities, tying the former to Benjamin Netanyahu's policies and the latter to Hamas's is not only wrong but terribly dangerous, writes Le Monde's Philippe Bernard in his column.

title: For the first time, two Asians are facing off in the World Chess Championship
summary: Starting on November 25 in Singapore, reigning champion Ding Liren from China will take on the young Indian player Gukesh Dommaraju in a 14-game match.

title: Ukraine: Russian drones sow terror in Kherson
summary: Hundreds of Ukrainian civilians have been the target of drone attacks from across the Dnipro. Located on the front line, the town of Kherson, occupied at the start of the war and liberated in November 2022, is slowly dying.

title: The French towns whose churches are closing due to disrepair and lack of funds
summary: At least 1,600 of the 40,000 religious buildings run by French local authorities are currently closed due to their dilapidated state. Municipal finances rarely allow them to undertake the often substantial repairs required.

title: Emmanuel Macron and Javier Milei on a balcony. Does anyone care?
summary: In Buenos Aires, Argentina, Presidents Emmanuel Macron and Javier Milei tried to be best buddies, a gamble they lost hands down.

title: Left-wing candidate Yamandú Orsi wins Uruguay presidential election
summary: Earlier in the evening the conservative candidate told his supporters it was time to congratulate his opponent. Analysts do not foresee a massive change in the country's direction.

title: Rape, assault, harassment: What do the numbers show about violence against women in France?
summary: From the time the #MeToo movement went viral, statistical sources and surveys have reported a steady increase in the number of complaints filed by women for sexual violence.

title: An Islamic State network that wanted to reach Europe has been dismantled in Côte d'Ivoire and Madagascar
summary: At the end of July, eight Syrians and Iraqis were arrested  in Abidjan and Antananarivo, with the support of US and French intelligence services, on suspicion of helping IS members travel out of the Middle East and planning an attack on the Paris Olympics.

title: US drawing up contingency plans for Taiwan emergency
summary: Kyodo news agency in Japan reports that US resources would be deployed on a Japanese island chain near Taiwan. If an emergency appears imminent, temporary bases would be set up on inhabited islands.

title: 20 women presidents of assemblies: 'What is Afghan women's crime? Being a woman. What is their mistake? Existing'
summary: To mark the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women on November 25, 20 female presidents of parliamentary chambers, including Yaël Braun-Pivet of France, Roberta Metsola of the European Parliament, and former speaker of the US House Nancy Peloci affirm their commitment to Afghan women's right to education.

title: Naomi Klein: Harris lost because people are 'in the mood to throw out who is in power'
summary: During the US presidential campaign, Democrats chose to ignore ordinary people in distress, while Donald Trump spoke to them, says the left-wing North American thinker in an interview.

title: Dominique Eddé, Lebanese novelist: 'In the Middle East, we were in a neurotic state; now we find ourselves on the edge of psychotic state'
summary: The writer denounces global silence in the face of the tragedy unfolding on Palestinian soil, a place now become the focal point for the all-consuming fear of disappearing.

title: Spiking drinks will become new criminal offense, UK government says
summary: Downing Street wants to make it easier to spot the 'cowardly act' of drugging someone to take abuse them and to take steps to better protect women, particularly in nightlife contexts.

title: French mass rape trial: Court to hear prosecutors' sentencing requests
summary: After 11 weeks of hearing drew to a close last week, prosecutors must now decide on appropriate potential punishments for lead defendant Dominique Pelicot and the 49 other defendants, men aged 26 to 74 and from all walks of life.

title: Musk plays increasingly encumbering role in British politics
summary: The billionaire, recently appointed to oversee efficiency in Trump's future administration, is waging a campaign against Labour on his social media platform, X.

title: At the Paris march to fight violence against women: 'If the Mazan rape trial can be the spark that ignites everything, so much the better'
summary: Two days before the International Day for the Elimination of Violence against Women, over 400 organizations and public figures called for demonstrations against violence against women in France on Saturday, November 23.

title: After the floods in northern France, a Michelin-starred chef fights to save his restaurant
summary: La Grenouillère has been unable to reopen since the river Canche burst its banks a year ago. This autumn, the water rose again, flooding the place that was still being renovated. To hold on to his team, Alexandre Gauthier has turned to projects in France and abroad.

title: The Israeli soldiers, killers and victims, treated for PTSD: 'You think we're monsters, don't you?'
summary: After more than a year of war in the Gaza Strip, many Israeli conscripts and reservists, witnesses and actors in the destruction of the Palestinian enclave, are developing post-traumatic stress disorder.

title: Three years after the worst migrant shipwreck in the Channel, crossings are more deadly than ever
summary: Thirty-one people died or disappeared when their dinghy sank on November 24, 2021, with no rescue services helping them. Despite an increase in police and sea rescue resources since then, the number of people trying to reach England in small boats has not abated and shipwrecks are multiplying.

title: Le Pen threatens to bring down French government over budget
summary: Asked on Monday after a meeting with the prime minister if her party would back a no-confidence motion, far-right leader Marine Le Pen replied: 'Of course.'

title: Pro-Russian far-right candidate makes unexpected breakthrough in Romania's presidential election
summary: Calin Georgescu, who is an admirer of Vladimir Putin and has expressed contempt for NATO and the European Union, came on top of the first round. Social-democrat prime minister Marcel Ciolacu, who came in third place, was eliminated.

title: To stay or not to stay on X, the big question for French media
summary: Following in the footsteps of The Guardian, France's regional media groups Ouest-France and Sud Ouest have decided to suspend their activity on Elon Musk's site. But some outlets argue the need to remain present on the platform.

title: Discussions over sending European troops to Ukraine reignited
summary: With the prospect of American disengagement from Kyiv following Donald Trump's return to the White House, Paris and London are not ruling out leading a military coalition in Ukraine.

title: 'It's unemployment that drives migrants to leave their countries, not poverty'
summary: Le Monde's Julien Bouissou writes that the scarcity of jobs in emerging countries, where 1.2 billion young people live, drives them to emigrate, threatening both these states' internal stability and also wealthy nations.

title: Eliane Heilbronn, the Chanel group family matriarch, has died
summary: Eliane Heilbronn was the lawyer who drafted famous creative director Karl Lagerfeld's contract with Chanel, as well as the mother of Alain and Gérard Wertheimer, discreet owners of the luxury group.

title: Pope slams conflicts in Ukraine and Palestinian territories
summary: In an unscripted remark made to diplomats, the pope blamed 'the arrogance of the invader' in 'Ukraine and Palestine,' days after he called for an investigation into claims Israel was conducting 'genocide' in Gaza.

title: Uruguay's left returns to power after moderate campaign
summary: Yamandu Orsi (left), won the presidential election on Sunday, November 24, in a run-off against Alvaro Delgado (center-right). While many countries in the region are experiencing a rise of the far right, Uruguay stands out as an exception.
